channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [KAFKA-7231] NetworkClient.newClientRequest() ignores custom request timeout in favor of the default
item.description:
The below code in org.apache.kafka.clients.KafkaClient is not passing in the provided requestTimeoutMs – it is ignoring it in favor of the defaultRequestTimeoutMs value.

@Override
public ClientRequest newClientRequest(String nodeId,
                                      AbstractRequest.Builder<?> requestBuilder,
                                      long createdTimeMs,
                                      boolean expectResponse,
                                      int requestTimeoutMs,
                                      RequestCompletionHandler callback) {
     return new ClientRequest(nodeId, requestBuilder, correlation++, clientId, createdTimeMs, expectResponse,
            defaultRequestTimeoutMs, callback);
}

This is an easy fix, but the impact of fixing it is difficult to quantify. Clients that set a custom timeout are getting the default timeout – fixing this will suddenly cause the custom timeout to take effect.
item.summary: NetworkClient.newClientRequest() ignores custom request timeout in favor of the default

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Ouch. I think the only place we use this is in the consumer when we override the join group timeout. Using the default in this case could cause problems when a consumer is first joining the group. In general retrying the JoinGroup is safe, but it causes problems when a member first joins the group since retries cause new members to be added.

hachikuji opened a new pull request #5444: KAFKA-7231; Ensure NetworkClient uses overridden request timeout
URL: https://github.com/apache/kafka/pull/5444

Fixed incorrect use of default timeout instead of the argument explicitly passed to `newClientRequest`.

      1. Committer Checklist (excluded from commit message)
  • [ ] Verify design and implementation
  • [ ] Verify test coverage and CI build status
  • [ ] Verify documentation (including upgrade notes)
